audio_caption: The audio clip features a sports commentary, where a male speaker excitedly describes a boxing match, highlighting the athletes and their actions like "This is good, this is better from Margarito," and a "wonderful left hand from Pacquiao". The tone is enthusiastic, as he analyzes the fight. Accompanying the commentary is the background noise of a crowd, presumably cheering and reacting to the boxing match.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker observing that someone is taking their foot off the gas, perhaps just taking a breather. The same speaker notes the strength involved in the fight against someone as big as Margarito. He continues, mentioning that if training hasn't been as good as it might have been, as the fight goes on, stamina and skills will have to come into effect. Then there is a general cheering sound indicating a crowd in the background.

The audio clip features a boxing match. Initially, the soundscape suggests an ongoing fight with background ambiance hinting at a crowd. A male speaker comments on the boxer, noting his successful right hand. Then the speaker comments on the performance of another boxer. He mentions that he might want to impress the judges. The speaker observes, "But the eye-catching punches, the accurate punches, have come from Pacquiao."

The audio clip features a male voice commentating on a boxing match, noting a fighter "marching forward" and "throwing them out, having the odd success." He mentions a fighter "twice beat Cintrón," and says Pacquiao is "in just a little bit of bother there, working away to the body." He notes "Pacquiao protests. He doesn't like those body shots", but that it's good for Margarito, Pacquiao wants to "buy a little bit of time", Margarito has "come right back into the reckoning," and Pacquiao is throwing "flurries of punches."  Crowd cheering is heard throughout the clip, with noticeable peaks during exciting moments.

The audio clip begins with the sounds of an energetic boxing match, cheering fans fill the background, the intensity of the match evident through the crowd's reactions. An announcer gives commentary on a Mexican boxer, "effort from the Mexican," acknowledging his presence in the fight and his terrific round. The sound of the match fades, revealing a male speaker, who then introduces Amir Khan to give his opinion on the fight's developments. Amir, sounding calm and thoughtful, praises the bravery of the fighter, pointing out the opponent's sharpness in clean shots. He mentions the probability of errors due to the opponent's forward approach. The announcer speaks again, emphasizing Margarito's strength and the potential challenges to the other fighter's stamina. Khan continues his analysis, talking about championship rounds and the need for constant movement. One of the fighters then complains of low body shots, to which another speaker replies there were a few went low there. The final part of the audio shifts back to a broader perspective, highlighting the blurred lines between fair and foul play, as they enter the second half of the fight.

The clip begins with a male speaker, in an excited and fast-paced manner, commenting on an event taking place, questioning "what's going on here? They're having a look at the eye". Another male speaker agrees, stating they’re "taking a bit of vaseline" off, because they put "a bit too much grease round there." He adds the boxer has "been asked to remove some". The speaker then says, "for the first time, you got the feeling he was getting to Pacquiao," and then notes "there's the score card." In the background, there's an excited crowd, with audible shouts and cheers, that contribute to the scene.
